interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/05/09 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Derrick Borte'], 'Producers': ['Mark Gill', 'Andrew Gunn'], 'Starring': ['Russell Crowe', 'Caren Pistorius', 'Gabriel Bateman'], 'Studio': ['Solstice Studios']} Review Text: First, Russel Crow has gotten REALLY FAT! And, I don't think he did it just for this movie. I think that his weight gain may be the reason why he was selected for this role, though.

This movie really will keep you on the edge of your seat. Some scenes are pretty shocking. And the ending was a total surprise, and a little cheesy. But, still good.

It was well worth the ticket. Five stars. Review Title: On the edge of your seat, for the whole movie! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Leitch'], 'Producers': ['Simon Kinberg', 'Ryan Reynolds', 'Lauren Shuler Donner'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Reynolds', 'Josh Brolin', 'Morena Baccarin'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']} I enjoyed the first Dead Pool movie. So, had to see the sequel. It's just as good as the first. But, there was so much vulgarity in it, I felt a little let down that they had to go that far with it, to push the 'anti-hero' theme. A great sequel to the original Dead Pool. But, much more vulgarity. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français (France)'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch [UT]', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (Latinoamérica) [CC]', 'Español (España) [CC]', 'Français [CC]', 'Italiano [CC]', 'Nederlands [CC]', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Português [SDH]', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Adam Somner', 'Daniel Lupi', 'Chris Defaria', 'Bruce Berman', 'Donald De Line', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger', 'Steven Spielberg', 'Dan Farah'], 'Starring': ['Tye Sheridan', 'Olivia Cooke', 'Ben Mendelsohn'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} I like the concept, how they integrated characters from so many of the classic video games. That is what really made the movie. Also, the movie itself was like a video game. That's fun for all you gamers. But, like they sometimes do, in Hollywood, they put all the best scenes in the trailer. So, there weren't any real great scenes left to impress you, as you watched the movie. The best scenes were in the trailers, but it's still a good movie. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Anthony Russo', 'Joe Russo'], 'Producers': ['Kevin Feige'], 'Starring': ['Robert Downey Jr.', 'Chris Hemsworth', 'Mark Ruffalo'], 'Studio': ['Marvel']} If you're an Avengers fan, and haven't seen this movie yet, it's a must see. I was a little lost, at first. Because I missed one or two of the movies leading up to this one. (How the hell did Thor lose his eye?) The cliffhanger at the end was both shocking and awesome. The directors did a good job. I'm fairly salivating for the next installment of the Avengers franchise! The best Avengers movie yet! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tyler Perry'], 'Producers': ['Mark E. Swinton', 'Will Areu', 'Tyler Perry'], 'Starring': ['Tiffany Haddish', 'Tika Sumpter', 'Omari Hardwick'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} I like the Madea character. I like the Madea movies. Of all the Tyler Perry movies, the comedies are the best. His dramas all fall flat on their face. His scripts are too predictable, characters too flat, story lines are like ruts on a muddy road. They follow a path, unwavering, till they get stuck... and.... die. Tiffany Haddish is great in this role. As are the other actors. They all make the movie tolerable. Some movies are larger than the actors in them. These actors are MUCH better than the movie they're in. It's still a Tyler Perry movie. Rear Window Suspense, Atmospheric, Compelling, Harrowing ['A bored, injured photojournalist confined to his apartment has no choice but to busy himself with observing his neighbors. His voyeurism becomes detective work, however, when he witnesses a murder. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.'] {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Hitchcock'], 'Starring': ['James Stewart', 'Grace Kelly', 'Wendell Corey']} First, I didn't actually rent this video. Somehow, someone hacked my Prime account and rented it. I'm sure it was just a test, to see if they could. I have since changed my password. However, I CAN tell you that, if you haven't seen this movie before, it's one worth watching. It's one of Alfred Hitchcock's best films. And, Jimmy Stewart was perfect in the leading role. I've seen it a few times over the years and really enjoyed it. In fact, there was a remake about ten years ago. But, the first is still the best. Jimmy Stewart and Alfred Hitchcock! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roland Emmerich'], 'Producers': ['Bradley Fischer', 'Harald Kloser', 'James Vanderbilt', 'Larry Franco', 'Laeta Kalogridis', 'Roland Emmerich'], 'Starring': ['Channing Tatum', 'Jamie Foxx', 'Maggie Gyllenhaal'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} It's a fun movie. Almost like a take off of Olympus has fallen. But, with enough comedic quality to make it just campy enough to enjoy, without going overboard like 'Airplane'. All of the acting was well done. The special effects were great. The movie kind of reminded me of Independence Day. But, a little funnier in parts. Worth watching. Kind of like Olympus has fallen. But campy like Independence Day. {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gregory Hoblit'], 'Producers': ['Charles Roven', 'Dawn Steel'], 'Starring': ['Denzel Washington', 'John Goodman', 'Donald Sutherland'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Honestly, my wife and I don't even remember watching it. So, it must not have been THAT great, or that bad. Either way, I'm sure we would have some kind of recollection of that movie. So, in all fairness, I have to go down the middle of the road here and give it three stars. Not memorable. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Derrick Borte'], 'Producers': ['Mark Gill', 'Andrew Gunn'], 'Starring': ['Russell Crowe', 'Caren Pistorius', 'Gabriel Bateman'], 'Studio': ['Solstice Studios']} First, Russel Crow has gotten REALLY FAT! And, I don't think he did it just for this movie. I think that his weight gain may be the reason why he was selected for this role, though.

This movie really will keep you on the edge of your seat. Some scenes are pretty shocking. And the ending was a total surprise, and a little cheesy. But, still good.

It was well worth the ticket. Five stars. On the edge of your seat, for the whole movie!
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Entertainment Preferences:** The user enjoys action-packed films, especially with comedic or anti-hero themes, and values well-crafted sequels, particularly in franchises like the Avengers. They have developed an appreciation for classic cinema, especially the suspenseful works of Alfred Hitchcock, while emphasizing the importance of unique and innovative storytelling over predictability.

- **Content Sensitivity:** They seek engaging narratives but remain sensitive to excessive vulgarity and inappropriate content, favoring impactful themes without gratuitous elements. The user enjoys films with surprise and depth, particularly those that create tension and unexpected conclusions.

- **Viewing Language:** Prefers English audio with audio descriptions for an inclusive viewing experience.

- **Rating Behavior:** Typically rates media highly, with an average rating around 4.7, but has displayed discernment in recent ratings. They recently awarded a perfect score to a film that effectively maintained suspense and delivered a surprising ending, despite noting some cheesy elements, reflecting their high standards for meaningful storytelling.

- **Engagement Style:** Provides thoughtful reviews that highlight performances while critiquing direction and narrative quality, focusing on character depth and innovative scripts. They appreciate films that balance humor with substantive content and maintain a critical perspective on narrative execution.

Overall, the user prioritizes quality in films, valuing innovative storytelling and character dynamics while navigating content sensitivity and showcasing a growing appreciation for classic films.
